data.title: Couple's Picture-Frame
data.solution:
import sys, math
# get the inputs
wife = str(input()); husband = str(input())
# make a copy of inputs
top = wife
low = husband
# get the desired size
size = math.lcm(top.__len__(),low.__len__())
print(size,file = sys.stderr)
# stack the strings to desired size
top*=int(size/top.__len__())
low*=int(size/low.__len__())
# print the top
print(top)
# print the sides
for i in range(size):
    print(low[i] + " "*(size-2) + top[i])
# print the final line
print(low)
data.statement:
You manufacture custom picture-frames for couples, such that:
~ the wife's name goes across the top and down the right side
~ the husband's name goes down the left side and across the bottom

Given the names of the [[wife]] and [[husband]] (or Partner#1 and Partner#2 if you prefer), draw the <<smallest>> frame possible.

Note: Don't split a name, such that part is vertical and part is horizontal.

data.stubGenerator:
read wife:string(25)
read husband:string(25)
write The Picture Frame
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1: >> A string [[wife]], denoting wife's name
<<Line 2: >> A string [[husband]], denoting husband's name

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You manufacture custom picture-frames for couples, such that:
~ the wife's name goes across the top and down the right side
~ the husband's name goes down the left side and across the bottom

Given the names of the wife and husband (or Partner#1 and Partner#2 if you prefer), draw the smallest frame possible.

Note: Don't split a name, such that part is vertical and part is horizontal.
Input
Line 1: A string wife, denoting wife's name
Line 2: A string husband, denoting husband's name
Output
Multiple Lines: That picture frame
Constraints
Example
Input
Margaret
Clarence
Output
Margaret
C      M
l      a
a      r
r      g
e      a
n      r
c      e
e      t
Clarence
